summary.para: Represents an Oracle database.

remarks.para: Internally uses Oracle .NET Managed Provider from Microsoft (System.Data.OracleClient) to connect to a Oracle 9i database.

When retrieving a result set, it will build the package name. The package name should be set based on the stored procedure prefix and this should be set via configuration. For example, a package name should be set as prefix of "ENTLIB_" and package name of "pkgENTLIB_ARCHITECTURE". For your applications, this is required only if you are defining your stored procedures returning ref cursors.

member.name: T:UTN.Framework.Data.Database
member.summary: Represents an abstract database that commands can be run against.

member.name: M:UTN.Framework.Data.Database.GetStoredProcCommandWithSourceColumns(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Wraps around a derived class's implementation of the GetStoredProcCommandWrapper method and adds functionality for using this method with UpdateDataSet. The GetStoredProcCommandWrapper method (above) that takes a params array expects the array to be filled with VALUES for the parameters. This method differs from the GetStoredProcCommandWrapper method in that it allows a user to pass in a string array. It will also dynamically discover the parameters for the stored procedure and set the parameter's SourceColumns to the strings that are passed in. It does this by mapping the parameters to the strings IN ORDER. Thus, order is very important.

param.name: storedProcedureName
param.para: The name of the stored procedure.

param.name: sourceColumns
param.para: The list of DataFields for the procedure.

summary.para: Creates a for a SQL query.

member.name: M:UTN.Framework.Data.Database.GetDataAdapter
member.summary: Gets the DbDataAdapter with the given update behavior and connection from the proper derived class. Created this new, public method instead of modifying the protected, abstract one so that there will be no breaking changes for any currently derived Database class.
member.returns: An .

member.name: M:UTN.Framework.Data.Oracle.OracleDatabase.PrepareCWRefCursor(System.Data.Common.DbCommand)
member.devdoc: This is a private method that will build the Oracle package name if your stored procedure has proper prefix and postfix. This functionality is include for the portability of the architecture between SQL and Oracle datbase. This method also adds the reference cursor to the command writer if not already added. This is required for Oracle .NET managed data provider.

member.summary: ConnectionString class constructs a connection string by inserting a username and password into a template.

member.remarks: It reads connection settings from the section in the config file.

member.devdoc: Gets the formatted connection string without the username and password.

member.summary: Formats a new connection string with a user ID and password.

member.name: M:UTN.Framework.Data.ConnectionString.GetFromConfig
member.summary: Returns the connection for the default connection.
member.remarks:
The default connection is the first one in the configurationStrings section i.e.:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <configuration> <connectionStrings> <add name="ConnStr1" connectionString="LocalSqlServer: data source=127.0.0.1;Integrated Security=SSPI;Initial Catalog=aspnetdb" providerName="System.Data.SqlClient" /> </connectionStrings> </configuration>
member.returns: The default from the config section

member.name: M:UTN.Framework.Data.ConnectionString.GetFromConfig(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a connection based on the name.
member.remarks:
i.e.:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <configuration> <connectionStrings> <add name="ConnStr1" connectionString="LocalSqlServer: data source=127.0.0.1;Integrated Security=SSPI;Initial Catalog=aspnetdb" providerName="System.Data.SqlClient" /> </connectionStrings> </configuration>
member.returns: The connection that matches the name

member.name: T:UTN.Framework.Data.Oracle.OracleDataReaderWrapper
member.devdoc: A wrapper to convert data for oracle for the reader.

member.name: M:UTN.Framework.Data.Oracle.OracleDataReaderWrapper.GetBoolean(System.Int32)
member.devdoc: Bit data type is mapped to a number in Oracle database. When reading bit data from Oracle database, it will map to 0 as false and everything else as true. This method uses System.Convert.ToBoolean() method for type conversions.

member.name: M:UTN.Framework.Data.Oracle.OracleDataReaderWrapper.GetFloat(System.Int32)
member.devdoc: When reading number from Oracle, data reader gets it back at decimal regardless of data type in Oracle database. This will cast the result to float data type.

member.name: M:UTN.Framework.Data.Oracle.OracleDataReaderWrapper.GetGuid(System.Int32)
member.devdoc: This method will cast the result data Guid data type. In Oracle you must use that as Raw(16) so that this method can convert that to Guid properly.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Commands Failed/sec is tha rate at which database commands failed to execute..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Enterprise Library Data Performance Counter Instances.

member.name: P:UTN.Framework.Data.Properties.Resources.ErrorConnectionFailedExtraInformation
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The connection string used was "{0}"..

member.name: P:UTN.Framework.Data.Properties.Resources.ErrorConnectionFailedMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The error occurred using the "{0}" database instance while attempting to open the database connection..

member.name: P:UTN.Framework.Data.Properties.Resources.ExceptionCommandNotSqlCommand
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The command must be a SqlCommand..

member.name: P:UTN.Framework.Data.Properties.Resources.ExceptionDatabaseTypeDoesNotHaveAssemblerAttribute
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The database type {0} for the name {1} does not have the required [DatabaseAssembler] attribute required to build the database object..

member.name: P:UTN.Framework.Data.Properties.Resources.ExceptionDatabaseTypeDoesNotHaveRequiredConfigurationTypeAttribute

member.name: P:UTN.Framework.Data.Properties.Resources.ExceptionMessageUpdateDataSetRowFailure
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Failed to update row .

member.name: P:UTN.Framework.Data.Properties.Resources.ExceptionNoDatabaseDefined

member.name: P:UTN.Framework.Data.Properties.Resources.ExceptionNoProviderDefinedForConnectionString
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The requested database {0} does not have provider name set in the connection string..

member.name: P:UTN.Framework.Data.Properties.Resources.ExceptionNullOrEmptyString
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The value can not be null or an empty string..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Parameter discovery is not supported for connections using GenericDatabase. You must specify the parameters explicitly, or configure the connection to use a type deriving from Database that supports parameter discovery..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The table name array used to map results to user-specified table names cannot be empty..

member.name: T:UTN.Framework.Data.UpdateBehavior
member.summary: Used with the Database.UpdateDataSet method. Provides control over behavior when the Data Adapter's update command encounters an error.

member.name: F:UTN.Framework.Data.UpdateBehavior.Standard
member.summary: No interference with the DataAdapter's Update command. If Update encounters an error, the update stops. Additional rows in the Datatable are uneffected.

member.name: F:UTN.Framework.Data.UpdateBehavior.Continue
member.summary: If the DataAdapter's Update command encounters an error, the update will continue. The Update command will try to update the remaining rows.

member.name: F:UTN.Framework.Data.UpdateBehavior.Transactional
member.summary: If the DataAdapter encounters an error, all updated rows will be rolled back.

member.name: T:UTN.Framework.Data.Oracle.IOraclePackage
member.summary: Represents the description of an oracle package.

member.name: P:UTN.Framework.Data.Oracle.IOraclePackage.Name
member.summary: When implemented by a class, gets the name of the package.

member.name: P:UTN.Framework.Data.Oracle.IOraclePackage.Prefix
member.summary: When implemented by a class, gets the prefix for the package.

summary.para: Provides parameter caching services for dynamic parameter discovery of stored procedures. Eliminates the round-trip to the database to derive the parameters and types when a command is executed more than once.
Populates the parameter collection for a command wrapper from the cache or performs a round-trip to the database to query the parameters.

param.name: command
param.para: The command to add the parameters.

param.name: database
param.para: The database to use to set the parameters.

summary.para: Empties the parameter cache.
Adds parameters to a command using the cache.

param.name: command
param.para: The command to add the parameters.

member.name: M:UTN.Framework.Data.ParameterCache.AlreadyCached(System.Data.IDbCommand,UTN.Framework.Data.Database)

summary.para: Checks to see if a cache entry exists for a specific command on a specific connection

member.returns: True if the parameters are already cached for the provided command, false otherwise
